concise_definition: adj. 闪烁的, 眨眼的; v. 眨眼, 闪烁 (blink 的现在分词)

definitions.explanation_en: Describing a light or signal that turns on and off rapidly in a regular or irregular pattern, often to attract attention or indicate status.
definitions.explanation_cn: 形容灯光或信号以快速、有规律或无规律的方式明灭，通常用于吸引注意或指示状态。
definitions.example_en: The blinking red light warned drivers that the crossing was active.
definitions.example_cn: 闪烁的红灯警告司机道口正在使用中。

definitions.explanation_en: Relating to or characterized by the rapid closing and opening of the eyelids, often involuntarily or as a reaction to light or emotion.
definitions.explanation_cn: 与快速闭合和睁开眼睑有关，通常是无意识的，或对光线、情绪的反应。
definitions.example_en: She gave him a blinking smile, unsure whether to believe him.
definitions.example_cn: 她眨了眨眼，露出一丝微笑，不确定是否该相信他。

definitions.explanation_en: To close and open the eyes rapidly and repeatedly, typically involuntarily or as a reflex.
definitions.explanation_cn: 快速而重复地闭合和睁开眼睛，通常是无意识的或作为反射动作。
definitions.example_en: He kept blinking to clear the dust from his eyes.
definitions.example_cn: 他不断眨眼，想把眼睛里的灰尘弄出去。

definitions.explanation_en: To emit light in short, intermittent flashes, as a signal or due to malfunction.
definitions.explanation_cn: 以短促、间歇的闪光方式发光，作为信号或因故障所致。
definitions.example_en: The dashboard indicator was blinking to signal a low fuel level.
definitions.example_cn: 仪表盘上的指示灯闪烁，提示燃油不足。

comparison.analysis: “Flickering” (摇曳闪烁) 通常指光线不稳定、微弱、不规则地明灭，常带有衰弱、即将熄灭的意味，如烛光或老旧灯泡。而 “blinking” 更强调有节奏、有目的的明灭，如交通灯或电子设备的提示灯，更具规律性和功能性。
“Flashing” (闪亮/闪现) 指光线或信号以明亮、突然、短暂的方式亮起，通常持续时间极短且强度高，用于紧急警示（如警报灯）。而 “blinking” 是重复性的、周期性的明灭，节奏较慢，多用于状态提示而非紧急警告。
“Winking” (眨眼示意) 是特指有意识地闭合一只眼睛，通常用于传递秘密信息、幽默或暗示，具有社交意图。而 “blinking” 是更中性的生理行为，可以是无意识的，不带有特定语义。
